RAPAS Photometry Pipeline (RPP)

// filepath: c:UserspierfP_F_Rdocapi_reference.rst API Reference =============

This section documents the key functions and modules in Photometry Factory for RAPAS. While the application is primarily designed as an integrated tool, its components can be used programmatically.

Core Functions

Image Processing

load_fits_data(file)

Load image data and header from a FITS file with robust error handling.

Parameters:

file (StreamlitUploadedFile) – FITS file object from Streamlit file uploader

Returns:

Tuple of (image_data, header)

Return type:

tuple(numpy.ndarray, astropy.io.fits.Header)

calibrate_image_streamlit(science_data, science_header, bias_data, dark_data, flat_data, exposure_time_science, exposure_time_dark, apply_bias, apply_dark, apply_flat)

Calibrates an astronomical image using bias, dark, and flat-field frames.

Parameters:

  • science_data (numpy.ndarray) – Raw science image data

  • science_header (dict or astropy.io.fits.Header) – FITS header

  • bias_data (numpy.ndarray or None) – Bias frame data

  • dark_data (numpy.ndarray or None) – Dark frame data

  • flat_data (numpy.ndarray or None) – Flat field data

  • exposure_time_science (float) – Exposure time of science image in seconds

  • exposure_time_dark (float) – Exposure time of dark frame in seconds

  • apply_bias (bool) – Whether to apply bias subtraction

  • apply_dark (bool) – Whether to apply dark subtraction

  • apply_flat (bool) – Whether to apply flat field correction

Returns:

Tuple of (calibrated_data, header)

Return type:

tuple(numpy.ndarray, dict)

Astrometry

solve_with_astrometry_net(image_data, header=None, api_key=None)

Solve astrometric plate using the astrometry.net web API.

Parameters:

  • image_data (numpy.ndarray) – The 2D image array to solve

  • header (astropy.io.fits.Header or dict, optional) – FITS header with metadata to help the solver

  • api_key (str, optional) – Astrometry.net API key

Returns:

Tuple of (wcs_object, updated_header, status_message)

Return type:

tuple(astropy.wcs.WCS, dict, str)

safe_wcs_create(header)

Create a WCS object from a FITS header with robust error handling.

Parameters:

header (dict or astropy.io.fits.Header) – FITS header containing WCS information

Returns:

Tuple of (wcs_object, error_message)

Return type:

tuple(astropy.wcs.WCS, str)

Source Detection & Photometry

find_sources_and_photometry_streamlit(image_data, _science_header, mean_fwhm_pixel, threshold_sigma, detection_mask)

Find astronomical sources and perform both aperture and PSF photometry.

Parameters:

  • image_data (numpy.ndarray) – Science image data

  • _science_header (dict or astropy.io.fits.Header) – FITS header information

  • mean_fwhm_pixel (float) – Estimated FWHM in pixels

  • threshold_sigma (float) – Detection threshold in sigma units

  • detection_mask (int) – Border size to mask in pixels

Returns:

Tuple of (phot_table, epsf_table, daofind, bkg)

Return type:

tuple(astropy.table.Table, astropy.table.Table, object, object)

perform_epsf_photometry(img, phot_table, fwhm, daostarfind, mask=None)

Perform PSF photometry using an empirically-constructed PSF model.

Parameters:

  • img (numpy.ndarray) – Image with sky background subtracted

  • phot_table (astropy.table.Table) – Table containing source positions

  • fwhm (float) – Full Width at Half Maximum in pixels

  • daostarfind (callable) – Star detection function

  • mask (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Mask to exclude image areas

Returns:

Tuple of (phot_epsf_result, epsf)

Return type:

tuple(astropy.table.Table, photutils.psf.EPSFModel)

fwhm_fit(img, fwhm, pixel_scale, mask=None, std_lo=0.5, std_hi=0.5)

Estimate the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of stars in an image.

Parameters:

  • img (numpy.ndarray) – The 2D image array

  • fwhm (float) – Initial FWHM estimate in pixels

  • pixel_scale (float) – Pixel scale in arcseconds per pixel

  • mask (numpy.ndarray, optional) – Boolean mask array for pixels to ignore

  • std_lo (float) – Lower bound for flux filtering

  • std_hi (float) – Upper bound for flux filtering

Returns:

Median FWHM value in pixels or None if failed

Return type:

float or None

Catalog Operations

cross_match_with_gaia_streamlit(_phot_table, _science_header, pixel_size_arcsec, mean_fwhm_pixel, gaia_band, gaia_min_mag, gaia_max_mag)

Cross-match detected sources with the GAIA DR3 star catalog.

Parameters:

  • _phot_table (astropy.table.Table) – Table with detected source positions

  • _science_header (dict or astropy.io.fits.Header) – FITS header with WCS information

  • pixel_size_arcsec (float) – Pixel scale in arcseconds per pixel

  • mean_fwhm_pixel (float) – FWHM in pixels

  • gaia_band (str) – GAIA magnitude band to use

  • gaia_min_mag (float) – Minimum magnitude for GAIA filtering

  • gaia_max_mag (float) – Maximum magnitude for GAIA filtering

Returns:

DataFrame with matched sources or None

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame or None

calculate_zero_point_streamlit(_phot_table, _matched_table, gaia_band, air)

Calculate photometric zero point from matched sources with GAIA.

Parameters:

  • _phot_table (astropy.table.Table or pandas.DataFrame) – Photometry results table

  • _matched_table (pandas.DataFrame) – Table of GAIA cross-matched sources

  • gaia_band (str) – GAIA magnitude band used

  • air (float) – Airmass value for atmospheric extinction

Returns:

Tuple of (zero_point_value, zero_point_std, matplotlib_figure)

Return type:

tuple(float, float, matplotlib.figure.Figure)

enhance_catalog_with_crossmatches(final_table, matched_table, header, pixel_scale_arcsec, search_radius_arcsec=6.0)

Enhance a photometric catalog with cross-matches from multiple databases.

Parameters:

  • final_table (pandas.DataFrame) – Final photometry catalog

  • matched_table (pandas.DataFrame) – Table of matched GAIA sources

  • header (dict or astropy.io.fits.Header) – FITS header with observation information

  • pixel_scale_arcsec (float) – Pixel scale in arcseconds

  • search_radius_arcsec (float) – Search radius for matching

Returns:

Enhanced DataFrame with catalog information

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Utilities

airmass(_header, observatory=None, return_details=False)

Calculate the airmass for a celestial object from observation parameters.

Parameters:

  • _header (dict) – FITS header with observation information

  • observatory (dict, optional) – Observatory information dictionary

  • return_details (bool) – Whether to return additional information

Returns:

Airmass value or tuple with details

Return type:

float or tuple(float, dict)

extract_pixel_scale(header)

Extract the pixel scale from a FITS header.

Parameters:

header (dict or astropy.io.fits.Header) – FITS header with metadata

Returns:

Tuple of (pixel_scale_value, source_description)

Return type:

tuple(float, str)

extract_coordinates(header)

Extract celestial coordinates from a FITS header.

Parameters:

header (dict or astropy.io.fits.Header) – FITS header with coordinate information

Returns:

Tuple of (ra, dec, source_description)

Return type:

tuple(float, float, str)

display_catalog_in_aladin(final_table, ra_center, dec_center, fov=0.5, ra_col='ra', dec_col='dec', mag_col='calib_mag', alt_mag_col='aperture_calib_mag', catalog_col='catalog_matches', id_cols=['simbad_main_id', 'skybot_NAME', 'aavso_Name'], fallback_id_prefix='Source', survey='CDS/P/DSS2/color')

Display a DataFrame catalog in an embedded Aladin Lite interactive sky viewer.

Parameters:

  • final_table (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing catalog data

  • ra_center (float) – Right Ascension center coordinate in degrees

  • dec_center (float) – Declination center coordinate in degrees

  • fov (float, optional) – Field of view in degrees

  • ra_col (str, optional) – Column name for Right Ascension

  • dec_col (str, optional) – Column name for Declination

  • mag_col (str, optional) – Column name for magnitude

  • alt_mag_col (str, optional) – Column name for alternative magnitude

  • catalog_col (str, optional) – Column name for catalog matches

  • id_cols (list[str], optional) – Column names for source identifiers

  • fallback_id_prefix (str, optional) – Prefix for unnamed sources

  • survey (str, optional) – Initial sky survey to display

Return type:

None

Usage Examples

Example: Load and calibrate an image

from astropy.io import fits

# Load science and calibration frames
science_data, science_header = fits.getdata('science.fits', header=True)
bias_data, _ = fits.getdata('bias.fits', header=True)
dark_data, dark_header = fits.getdata('dark.fits', header=True)
flat_data, _ = fits.getdata('flat.fits', header=True)

# Get exposure times
exposure_time_science = science_header.get('EXPTIME', 1.0)
exposure_time_dark = dark_header.get('EXPTIME', 1.0)

# Calibrate image
calibrated_data, calibrated_header = calibrate_image_streamlit(
    science_data, science_header,
    bias_data, dark_data, flat_data,
    exposure_time_science, exposure_time_dark,
    apply_bias=True, apply_dark=True, apply_flat=True
)

Example: Perform photometry and zero-point calibration

import numpy as np

# Set parameters
pixel_size_arcsec = 1.2
mean_fwhm_pixel = 3.0
threshold_sigma = 3.0
detection_mask = 50

# Find sources and perform photometry
phot_table, epsf_table, daofind, bkg = find_sources_and_photometry_streamlit(
    calibrated_data, calibrated_header,
    mean_fwhm_pixel, threshold_sigma, detection_mask
)

# Get catalog matches
matched_table = cross_match_with_gaia_streamlit(
    phot_table, calibrated_header,
    pixel_size_arcsec, mean_fwhm_pixel,
    "phot_g_mean_mag", 10.0, 18.0
)

# Calculate zero point (using airmass=1.0)
zp, zp_std, _ = calculate_zero_point_streamlit(
    phot_table, matched_table, "phot_g_mean_mag", 1.0
)

# Apply zero point to get calibrated magnitudes
calibrated_mags = phot_table['instrumental_mag'] + zp + 0.1*1.0  # Apply extinction
